==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|みつ|また|yomi=kun}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=みつまた|三つ|tr1=mitsu|t1=three|叉|tr2=mata|t2=fork, bifurcation}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="SMK5">{{R:Shinmeikai5}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kun|acc=0|acc_ref=NHK,DJR,SMK5|みつまた}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|三つ股}}, {{ja-l|三つ叉}}, {{ja-l|三つ俣}}
* {{ja-l|三椏}} {{qualifier|limited to the "bush" sense}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|みつまた}}

# a [[three-way]] [[fork]], such as in a [[road]], [[river]], or [[tree]]
# a [[trident]]
# {{alternative spelling of|lang=ja|sort=みつまた|三椏|dot=:}} the {{vern|paper bush}}, {{taxlink|Edgeworthia chrysantha|species|noshow=1}}, from the way the bush branches in threes
#: This sense is more commonly spelled {{ja-l|三椏}} in kanji. As with many terms naming organisms, this is often spelled in katakana in biology contexts, as {{ja-l|ミツマタ}}.

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|みつまた}}

# an area along the [[w:Sumida River|Sumida River]] in [[Tokyo]] between the [[w:Sumida River#Sumida bridges|Shin Ōhashi]] and the [[w:Sumida River#Sumida bridges|Kiyosu-bashi]] bridges, near the [[inlet]] of the Onagi Canal

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|さん|さ|yomi=on}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=さんさ}} {{m|ltc|三叉}}. Compare modern {{cog|cmn|三叉|tr=sānchā}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=on|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5|さんさ}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|さんさ}}

# a [[three-way]] [[fork]], such as in a [[road]], [[river]], or [[tree]]
